lines.text: You are a son of God.

[in tears]
Thank you. I've never been called a son of God before.
[laughs slightly]
I've been called a son of a you-know-what plenty of times, but I've never been called a son of God.
Tell me something sister, what is nun doing in a place like this. Shouldn't you be teaching children? Didn't you know what this man has done? How he killed them kids?
What he was involved with was evil. I don't condone it. I just don't see the sense of killing people to say that killing people's wrong.
You know what the Bible say, 'An eye for an eye'.
You know what else the Bible ask for death as a punishment? For adultery, prostitution, homosexuality, trespass upon sacred grounds, profane in a sabbath and contempt to parents.
I ain't gonna get no Bible quote from no nun cause I'm gonna lose.
I want the last face you see in this world to be the face of love, so you look at me when they do this thing. I'll be the face of love for you.
Show me some respect, Matthew.
Why? 'Cause you're a nun?
Because I'm a person.
'Justice has been done.'

I never gave a ticket to a nun before. I gave a ticket to a guy from the IRS one time. Got audited the next year. I'll tell you what, this time I'll let this one slide, but keep your speed down, yeah?
Thank you for loving me.
A mother's arms are strong when her child is in danger.
Do you have any last words, Poncelet?
Yes, I do.
[pauses]
Mr. Delacroix, I don't wanna leave this world with any hate in my heart. I ask your forgiveness for what I done. It was a terrible thing I done, taking your son away from you.

[Softly to his wife]
How about us?
Mr. and Mrs. Percy, I hope my death gives you some relief.
Look at you. Death is looking down your neck, and you're playing your little male come-on games.
It's quiet. Only three days left. Plenty of time to read my Bible and look for a loophole.
My wife filed for divorce this afternoon. We just have different ways to deal with our son's death. Until death do us part.
I like rebels. Some blacks is ok. Martin Luther King, he led his people all the way to DC and kicked the white man's butt.
You respect Martin Luther King?
He put up a fight. He wasn't lazy.
What about lazy whites?
Don't like 'em.
So it's lazy people you don't like?
I just wanna say I think killin' is wrong, no matter who does it, whether it's me or y'all or your government.
If Matt dies, guess who he'll be buried next to?
Who's the last person to die?
Sister Celestine.
Oh Lord.
You remember when that sweet little girl in the convent came after her wedding day to introduce her husband to us?
Sister Celestine said, "I'm glad I never had to share my bed with a man."
She loved her celibacy so much.
I know. She's gonna be lying next to a man for all eternity.
How can you stand next to him?
Mr. Percy, I'm just trying to follow the example of Jesus, who said that a person is not as bad as his worst deed.
This is not a person. This is an animal.
It's not faith, it's work.
Hitler got things done!
I was just fucking chicken.
